sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Judicial Districts Act of 2021.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Judicial Districts Act of 2021.

sections.heading: Legislative intent. The intent of this Act is to redraw the Judicial Districts to meet the requirements of the Illinois Constitution of 1970 by providing that outside of the First District the State "shall be divided by law into four Judicial Districts of substantially equal population, each of whic
sections.text: Legislative intent. The intent of this Act is to redraw the Judicial Districts to meet the requirements of the Illinois Constitution of 1970 by providing that outside of the First District the State "shall be divided by law into four Judicial Districts of substantially equal population, each of which shall be compact and composed of contiguous counties."

sections.heading: of Article VI of the Illinois Constitution of 1970 divides the State into five Judicial Districts for the selection of Supreme and Appellate Court Judges, with Cook County comprising the First District and the remainder of the State "divided by law into four Judicial Districts of substantially equal
sections.text: The current Judicial District map was enacted in 1963.

sections.heading: The First Judicial District consists of the County of Cook.
sections.text: The First Judicial District consists of the County of Cook.

sections.heading: Beginning on the effective date of this Act, the Second Judicial District consists of the counties of DeKalb, Kendall, Kane, Lake, and McHenry.
sections.text: Beginning on the effective date of this Act, the Second Judicial District consists of the counties of DeKalb, Kendall, Kane, Lake, and McHenry.

sections.heading: Beginning on the effective date of this Act, the Third Judicial District consists of the counties of Bureau, LaSalle, Grundy, Iroquois, Kankakee, DuPage and Will
sections.text: Beginning on the effective date of this Act, the Third Judicial District consists of the counties of Bureau, LaSalle, Grundy, Iroquois, Kankakee, DuPage and Will.

sections.heading: Beginning on the effective date of this Act, the Fourth Judicial District consists of the counties of Jo Daviess, Stephenson, Carroll, Ogle, Lee, Winnebago, Boone, Mercer, Rock Island, Whiteside, Henry, Stark, Putnam, Marshall, Peoria, Tazewell, Adams, Pike, Calhoun, Schuyler, Brown, Cass, Mason, Me
sections.text: Beginning on the effective date of this Act, the Fourth Judicial District consists of the counties of Jo Daviess, Stephenson, Carroll, Ogle, Lee, Winnebago, Boone, Mercer, Rock Island, Whiteside, Henry, Stark, Putnam, Marshall, Peoria, Tazewell, Adams, Pike, Calhoun, Schuyler, Brown, Cass, Mason, Menard, Morgan, Scott, Greene, Jersey, Macoupin, Sangamon, Logan, McLean, Woodford, Livingston, Ford, Henderson, Warren, Knox, Fulton, McDonough and Hancock.

sections.heading: Beginning on the effective date of this Act, the Fifth Judicial District consists of the counties of DeWitt, Macon, Piatt, Moultrie, Champaign, Douglas, Vermilion, Edgar, Coles, Cumberland, Clark, Christian, Shelby, Montgomery, Fayette, Effingham, Jasper, Clay, Marion, Clinton, Bond, Madison, St
Current Members of the Judiciary
sections.text: Nothing in this Act shall affect the tenure of any Appellate or Supreme Court Judge serving on the effective date of this Act. No Appellate or Supreme Court Judge serving on the effective date of this Act shall be required to change his or her residency in order to

sections.heading: Severability. To the extent that any provision of this Act is found to be unconstitutional, that provision alone shall be deemed of no force and effect and all other provisions of this Act shall remain in full force and effect
sections.text: Severability. To the extent that any provision of this Act is found to be unconstitutional, that provision alone shall be deemed of no force and effect and all other provisions of this Act shall remain in full force and effect.

sections.heading: The Judicial Redistricting Act of 1997 (which has been held unconstitutional) is repealed.
sections.text: The Judicial Redistricting Act of 1997 (which has been held unconstitutional) is repealed.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
